did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Architectural drawings, photographs, manuscripts, and newspaper clippings.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Drawings, photographs, plans, and specifications of Ithaca and Cornell buildings by Miller, list of newspaper articles concerning Miller and notable architecture in Ithaca, and a biographical sketch of Miller by Dethlefsen.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: William Henry Miller (1848-1922), was a student of the Cornell University College of Architecture from 1868 to 1870, later becoming a prominent Ithaca, New York architect. He designed several buildings on the Cornell University campus.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Drawings, photographs (positive and negative), plans, and specifications of Ithaca and Cornell buildings by Miller, list of newspaper articles concerning Miller and notable architecture in Ithaca (1870-1917), and a biographical sketch of Miller by Dethlefsen.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Building plans are restricted to permission of the office of Planning Design and Construction.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Edgar Raymond Dethlefsen, Collector. William Henry Miller Papers, #1856. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: See also: William Henry Miller miscellany, #2811 http://resolver.library.cornell.edu/cgi-bin/EADresolver?id=RMM02811

unittitle.extref: Link to a partial finding aid.

scopecontent.p: All the material in the collection may not be covered by this guide.
